cheatsheet.title: Create a new schema overview analysis

intro.description: This type of analysis examines one specific schema in a database. The analysis returns information about the physical structure of the database.

item.title: Select schema to analyse
item.description:
Note that schema analysis is only possible in databases that include schema entities in their physical structure.
To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyzes on the DQ Repository view and select New Analysis. Then Expand Structural Analysis and select Schema Overview Analysis in order to browse to and select the schema to analyze. The wizard prompts you to provide the schema analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Add table or view filters if required, using SQL language. Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata or settings, if necessary.

item.title: Review your settings
item.description: In the editor you can modify the analysis metadata or settings. Click Analysis Parameters to expand the editor. In this view of the editor you can check or modify the table or view filters.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: Click the Run icon, located towards the top left of the editor, to execute the analysis. Alternatively, right click the analysis on the DQ Repository tree view and click the Run icon on the list which appears.
